instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2523: What is 820-2523? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message:
Hello
this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B boots up normally until it nearly finishes loading. Then it shows the attaches picture, shuts off, turns automatically back on and repeats this process. If i want to install OSX with an usb drive it works until i go to the "disk utility window" where i normally can create partitions or wipe the drive. In this window, before i can see any drive information, it keeps spinning the "colored wheel" - with different drives ans drive cables same thing. The strange thing is that it will boot up normally with a drive from another Macbook with OSX already installed. I´m really not sure what to do with this one but my guess is Kernel Panic and <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> but i´m confused because it works just fine with the other drive. Or could it be a to new version of OSX for this machine on the original drive? Thanks for any help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message: Bad RAM? Make sure only to use PC8500 RAM. Also issues with 8GB in these boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message: I tryed different ram but its doing the same thing with 2x1GB PC8500 too. Also it sometimes displays the "Your computer restarts because of a problem...." message that i attached after shutting off and back on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message: Tried one slot at a time? Could be 1 bad slot. Besides bad RAM/slot there is not much to do about this antique. Disconnect everything not needed, especially airport cable can cause issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message: Ok, thank you. I tryed both slots and nothing else plugged in. No success. Any idea why it starts with one drive from another Macbook?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message: No idea, run ASD and see if anything comes up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Kernel Panic?
threads.message: OK, Thank you. I´ll see what ASD says here and if there are no issues i´ll leave this board alone.
